intro: Elatostema sessile f. geminatum, commonly known as the twinleaf elatostema, is a compact, herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettles and related species. The plant features small, opposite leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its flowers are tiny and clustered, often greenish-white in color, and it produces small, round berries as fruit.
